metadata.title: CVE-2020-35522 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - negligible.
metadata.description:
In LibTIFF, there is a memory malloc failure in tif_pixarlog.c. A crafted TIFF document can lead to an abort, resulting in a remote denial of service attack.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2020-35522` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libtiff-opengl - 4.1.0+git201212-1ubuntu1
libtiff-tools - 4.1.0+git201212-1ubuntu1
libtiff5 - 4.1.0+git201212-1ubuntu1
libtiffxx5 - 4.1.0+git201212-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.note: mdeslaur> this issue simply causes the tiff2rgba tool to abort on a malformed image, and has very little security impact.

criterions.comment: tiff package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.1.0+git201212-1ubuntu1').
